intro: Aneilema nigritanum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and are pollinated by insects. Aneilema nigritanum is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
